snippet: An independent human rights panel found that Liberian security forces fired directly into a crowd of civilians who were protesting a quarantine this summer.
abstract: Investigation conducted by Liberian Independent National Commission on Human Rights finds country's security forces fired with 'complete disregard for human life' into crowds of civilians protesting blanket Ebola quarantine over summer; findings directly contradict repeated assertions by security forces, including American-trained Liberian Army.
lead_paragraph: An independent human rights panel found that Liberian security forces fired directly into a crowd of civilians who were protesting a quarantine this summer.

headline.main: Inquiry Faults Liberia Force That Fired on Protesters
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Faults Liberia Force That Fired on Protesters
